Daat do you have an existing 7.10 running? would you like to try and boot the downloaded 8.04 iso from hd?
i had 7.10, but updated to 8.04 yesterday :P that's when the problems started
the only options at boot i have are 8.04 (with new and previous kernel)
believe so. It's... 2.24 I think (trying to recall from memory) and new is 2.26, or something. You probably know it better than I do :)
then try to boot from the previous and we can probably load the new 8.04 from hard disk
will do. How do I go about booting the ISO from HDD?
you have to mount the iso, then copy it over to a ext2 partition ext2 okay not ext3 and then put an entry on exisisting menu.lst for the new 8.04
i'll look into it. But i have to say, when i boot into 7.10, there are no taskbars (top and bottom). Happened after yesterday's update
